pros: Pretty good place to work
cons: Can't complain much about it

pros: Easy, flexible, good pay, can do homework
cons: Not a lot of hours

pros: Norco has a friendly and helpful feel. Like a big family we support each other towards reaching our goal.
cons: Students have many other commitments besides school creating barriers to learning.

pros: A lot of time dedicated to yourself during work when no students arrived.
cons: Can't leave shift when students no show.

pros: You pick which hours available to work.
cons: Some people have bad attitudes.

job_title: Grants Administrative Specialist in Norco, CA
pros: State holidays, flexible hours, good people
cons: Some managers micro manage. Chancellor is not very nice if you aren’t faculty or management

pros: Small, comfortable feel, lots of personal interaction with all levels of leadership. Students tent to have good attitudes too.
cons: Small means meager with no guarantee that promotions become available or class attendance remains high.

pros: good time, good people, very friendly
cons: no cons for me, its great.

review_title: Norco College is an excellent work environment in the community college system!
job_title: Instructional Technology Specialist in Norco, CA
pros: Great experience, great opportunities, great benefits!
cons: There are no cons in working for Norco College!

job_title: Computer Lab Assistant in Norco, CA
pros:
There is a great feeling of collaboration and care for the students, staff, and teachers - working here makes you feel like you are really impacting the students you help.
The pay is also great, well above average for my position - though at part-time there are no benefits, but that's expected.
cons: Funding is always a problem with the state controlling it's flow, there are rarely any monies for change and upgrades.

job_title: Supplemental Instruction Leader in Norco, CA
pros: The hours are flexible and they can work really well with your schedule.  As a current student I find it easy to balance my schoolwork with this position.
cons: There are a lot of meetings that have mandatory attendance that can often seem to be repetitive. We will often go over the same material over and over.

pros: Great Work environment. Environment is relatively relaxed and stress free as long as workers are completing all tasks given by management and services conducted at a high standard.
cons: Not much room for advancement or more hours for part-time workers; although this can be expected because of state budget cuts and restrictions.

review_title: Norco College - One of the best colleges in the Inland Empire
job_title: Instructional Technology Specialist in Norco, CA
pros: The faculty and staff are friendly.  The benefits are great.  Everyone works to support one another and transfer knowledge.  They have the best gaming development department, and an excellent Career and Technical Education program.
cons: It isn't a university, but it should be considered equivalent to a university experience as regards student life and post-graduate employment opportunities.

review_title: Excellent opportunities and chance to travel
pros:
- Get to help students achieve their educational goals
- Become a certified tutor
- Respectable salary compared to other community college LRCs
- Plenty of conferences in exciting placed to travel to
- Amazing bosses and supervisors
- Great working environment; fun co-workers and flexible scheduling
cons: - Need to complete ILA course in order to be certified

review_title: Great place to work for first job
job_title: Supplemental Instruction Leader in Norco, CA
pros: Great training and team. Opportunity to be creative and help other students succeed.
cons: Do not get the chance to work much (about a few hours a day) so your hourly pay does not add up to much.

review_title: Not a horrible place to work at
pros: The benefits are great. As well as paid sick and vacation time off
cons: You cannot contribute to big decisions. It is really hard to receive a promotion

pros: They work with your schedule so you can tutor around or between your classes.
cons: Students don't always show up, making you lose time and money.

review_title: Great Work Culture, Great Place to Work
job_title: Media & Marketing Technician in Norco, CA
pros:
Team Oriented
Great Leadership
Great Work Culture

Job Security
cons: I have nothing bad to say about working at Norco College

job_title: Supplemental Instructor and Tutor in Norco, CA
pros: Good culture of comradery, helping students learn has high intrinsic rewards
cons: Low ability to negotiate for time or pay, aggressive cost-cutting program is hurting employees

review_title: It's a teaching job at a community college. Enough said.
pros: A good job if you enjoy teaching.
cons: Low pay for part-time adjuncts.
